We will refer primarily to non-GAAP financial measures during this call. The full non-GAAP to GAAP reconciliations are available in today's press
release and slides posted on our website.Participants in today's conference call are Dr. Lisa Su, our Chair and Chief Executive Officer; Jean Hu, our Executive Vice President, Chief FinancialOfficer and Treasurer; and Devinder Kumar, our Executive Vice President. This is a live call and will be replayed via webcast on our website.", 'segment_page_start': 2, 'segment_page_end': 2, 'chunk_page_start': 2, 'chunk_page_end': 2, 'text': "Document context: the following excerpt is from a document titled 'Q4 2022 Advanced Micro Devices Inc Earnings Call'. We will refer primarily to non-GAAP financial measures during this call. The full non-GAAP to GAAP reconciliations are available in today's press
release and slides posted on our website.Participants in today's conference call are Dr. Lisa Su, our Chair and Chief Executive Officer; Jean Hu, our Executive Vice President, Chief FinancialOfficer and Treasurer; and Devinder Kumar, our Executive Vice President. This is a live call and will be replayed via webcast on our website."}

{'doc_id': '3Q22 10-Q', 'chunk_start': 717, 'chunk_end': 718, 'score': np.float64(0.5426433639222967), 'content': "Document context: the following excerpt is from a document titled 'FORM 10-Q'. This document is about: the quarterly financial performance and operations of Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. for the period ended September 24, 2022, including financial statements and management's discussion.

Financing Activities
Net cash used in financing activities was $3.1 billion for the nine months ended September 24, 2022, which primarily
consisted of common stock repurchases of $3.5 billion, repurchases for tax withholding on employee equity plans of
$371 million and repayment of debt of $312 million, partially offset by proceeds from the issuance of debt of $991
million and a cash inflow of $79 million from issuance of common stock under our employee equity plans.
Net cash used in financing activities was $1.2 billion for the nine months ended September 25, 2021, which primarily
consisted of common stock repurchases of $1.0 billion and repurchases for tax withholding on employee equity plans
of $219 million, partially offset by a cash inflow of $55 million from issuance of common stock under our employee
equity plans.
39

{'doc_id': '1Q20 10-Q', 'chunk_start': 374, 'chunk_end': 375, 'score': np.float64(1.4461318956182894), 'content': "Document context: the following excerpt is from a document titled 'FORM 10-Q'. This document is about: the quarterly financial performance and operations of Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. for the period ended March 28, 2020, including financial statements and management's discussion and analysis.

FINANCIAL CONDITION
Liquidity and Capital Resources
As of March 28, 2020, our cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities were $1.4 billion, compared to $1.5 billion as of December 28, 2019. The percentage of cash and cash equivalents
held domestically was 90% as of both March 28, 2020 and December 28, 2019.
Our operating, investing and financing activities for the three months ended March 28, 2020 compared to the prior year period are as described below:
Three Months Ended
March 28,
2020
March 30,
2019
(In millions)
Net cash provided by (used in):
Operating activities $ (65) $ (213)
Investing activities $ (73) $ (173)
Financing activities $ 2 $ 286
The aggregate principal amount of our outstanding debt obligations was $563 million as of both March 28, 2020 and December 28, 2019.
As a precautionary measure given the current market environment, on April 6, 2020, we borrowed $200 million under the Credit Agreement via the LIBOR rate loan option (refer to Note 4 - Debt
and Secured Revolving Facility of the Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements). The borrowing carries an annual interest rate of 2.37% through the maturity date of July 6, 2020.
We believe our cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities balance along with our Secured Revolving Facility will be sufficient to fund operations, including capital expenditures, over the
next 12 months. We believe we will be able to access the capital markets should we require additional funds. However, we cannot assure that such funds will be available on favorable terms, or at all.
Operating Activities", 'segment_page_start': 23, 'segment_page_end': 23, 'chunk_page_start': 23, 'chunk_page_end': 23, 'text': "Document context: the following excerpt is from a document titled 'FORM 10-Q'. As of March 28, 2020, our cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities were $1.4 billion, compared to $1.5 billion as of December 28, 2019. The percentage of cash and cash equivalents
held domestically was 90% as of both March 28, 2020 and December 28, 2019.

The aggregate principal amount of our outstanding debt obligations was $563 million as of both March 28, 2020 and December 28, 2019.
As a precautionary measure given the current market environment, on April 6, 2020, we borrowed $200 million under the Credit Agreement via the LIBOR rate loan option (refer to Note 4 - Debt
and Secured Revolving Facility of the Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements). The borrowing carries an annual interest rate of 2.37% through the maturity date of July 6, 2020.
We believe our cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities balance along with our Secured Revolving Facility will be sufficient to fund operations, including capital expenditures, over the

queries.query: AMD ramps up return of capital to shareholders "share repurchases" "dividend" press release investor relations
results:
{'doc_id': '01_32_2023_LSEG_Transcript', 'chunk_start': 112, 'chunk_end': 113, 'score': np.float64(0.5102509373018731), 'content': "Document context: the following excerpt is from a document titled 'Q4 2022 Advanced Micro Devices Inc Earnings Call'. This document is about: the financial performance and operational updates of Advanced Micro Devices Inc. for the fourth quarter and full year of 2022, including revenue growth, segment performance, and future outlook.

Turning to the balance sheet. We have a strong balance sheet with cash, cash equivalents and short-term investment of $5.9 billion at the end of
the fourth quarter. During the quarter, we returned $250 million to shareholders through share repurchases. In 2022, we returned a total of $3.7
billion to shareholders which was 119% of free cash flow. We have $6.5 billion in remaining authorization to share repurchases. Free cash flow was
$443 million compared to $736 million in the same quarter last year.
Free cash flow decreased primarily due to higher inventory. Inventory was $3.8 billion, up approximately $402 million from the prior quarter,
primarily driven by the inventory increase in advanced process nodes to support the ramp of new products.", 'segment_page_start': 6, 'segment_page_end': 6, 'chunk_page_start': 6, 'chunk_page_end': 6, 'text': "Document context: the following excerpt is from a document titled 'Q4 2022 Advanced Micro Devices Inc Earnings Call'. This document is about: the financial performance and operational updates of Advanced Micro Devices Inc. for the fourth quarter and full year of 2022, including revenue growth, segment performance, and future outlook.

Turning to the balance sheet. We have a strong balance sheet with cash, cash equivalents and short-term investment of $5.9 billion at the end of
the fourth quarter. During the quarter, we returned $250 million to shareholders through share repurchases. In 2022, we returned a total of $3.7
billion to shareholders which was 119% of free cash flow. We have $6.5 billion in remaining authorization to share repurchases. Free cash flow was
$443 million compared to $736 million in the same quarter last year.
Free cash flow decreased primarily due to higher inventory. Inventory was $3.8 billion, up approximately $402 million from the prior quarter,
primarily driven by the inventory increase in advanced process nodes to support the ramp of new products."}

{'doc_id': '3Q22 10-Q', 'chunk_start': 1613, 'chunk_end': 1614, 'score': np.float64(0.5727603048360475), 'content': "Document context: the following excerpt is from a document titled 'FORM 10-Q'. This document is about: the quarterly financial performance and operations of Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. for the period ended September 24, 2022, including financial statements and management's discussion.

In May 2021, our Board of Directors approved a stock repurchase program of up to $4 billion of our common stock
(Existing Repurchase Program). In February 2022, our Board of Directors approved a new stock repurchase program in
addition to our Existing Repurchase Program to purchase up to $8 billion of our outstanding common stock in the open
market (collectively referred to as the Repurchase Program). The Repurchase Program does not obligate us to acquire
any  common  stock,  has  no  termination  date  and  may  be  suspended  or  discontinued  at  any  time.  Our  stock
repurchases could affect the trading price of our stock, the volatility of our stock price, reduce our cash reserves, and
may be suspended or discontinued at any time, which may result in a decrease in our stock price.", 'segment_page_start': 93, 'segment_page_end': 93, 'chunk_page_start': 93, 'chunk_page_end': 93, 'text': "Document context: the following excerpt is from a document titled 'FORM 10-Q'. This document is about: the quarterly financial performance and operations of Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. for the period ended September 24, 2022, including financial statements and management's discussion.

In May 2021, our Board of Directors approved a stock repurchase program of up to $4 billion of our common stock
(Existing Repurchase Program). In February 2022, our Board of Directors approved a new stock repurchase program in
addition to our Existing Repurchase Program to purchase up to $8 billion of our outstanding common stock in the open
market (collectively referred to as the Repurchase Program). The Repurchase Program does not obligate us to acquire
any  common  stock,  has  no  termination  date  and  may  be  suspended  or  discontinued  at  any  time.  Our  stock
repurchases could affect the trading price of our stock, the volatility of our stock price, reduce our cash reserves, and
may be suspended or discontinued at any time, which may result in a decrease in our stock price."}
